ground_truth: He quickly turns his wheelchair around to the window until he is in profile. The salesman, having just raised the shades in the living room, is now looking out the window. His eyes move closer toward Jeff's apartment. Jeff in his chair, facing the window, Stella beside him. Jeff nearly knocks the startled Stella off her feet with his arm. He propels his chair backward quickly, and Stella moves to the side with surprising agility. They are both in shadow. Jeff keeps his eyes trained on the window. The salesman completes his searching glance at the neighborhood. Then something directly below his window catches his attention. He looks sharply downward, his body visibly tensing. Jeff, with a restraining hand to Stella, begins to edge his chair cautiously forward so that he can see what the salesman is looking at. The camera pans down, and we now see that the old lady with the hearing aid is leaning over the fence admonishing the dog. The salesman leans forward and grips the window sill as he watches the dog. The camera moves forward, and as it reaches the edge of the window, pans down and shows us what the salesman is looking at. The little dog that was lowered in the basket is sniffing at the salesman's personal flower bed. Jeff's eyes move up quickly to look at the salesman. We can faintly hear her voice saying something to the effect that he'll get into trouble. The old lady is wearing a faded house-robe. The dog turns to glance at her and, apparently taking heed, moves away. Jeff is amused at the dog incident. Behind him, Stella moves to the center of the room, saying. She begins putting her equipment back into her black bag. Jeff's eyes lift to the salesman's apartment, and the amusement drains from his face. He is carefully wiping out the interior with a dust cloth. The salesman has his aluminum case on the table near the center of the room. Jeff continues to watch the salesman, his face showing a great concentration of thought. Jeff watching intently. Stella picks up her bag, stares at Jeff's back a moment, then starts for the door. Jeff swings halfway around in his chair just as Stella reaches the top of the steps. She turns around. Jeff points to a coat-stand near the door. She puts down her bag, reaches for the binoculars, takes them out of the case. She comes down the stairs, brings them to him. Stella sniffs, then goes to the door, as she says. As Stella goes out the door, the camera moves in until Jeff's head and the binoculars are filling the screen. He immediately swings to the window and lifts them to his eyes.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution

His eyes shift closer toward Jeff's apartment. Jeff in his chair, facing the window, Stella beside him. Jeff nearly knocks the startled Stella off her feet with his arm. He drives his chair backward swiftly, and Stella moves to the side with surprising nimbleness. They are both in shadow. Jeff keeps his eyes trained on the window. The vendor completes his searching glance at the neighborhood. Then something directly below his window seizes his attention. He looks sharply downward, his body visibly tensing. She begins putting her gear back into her black bag. Jeff's eyes rise to the vendor's apartment, and the amusement drains from his face. He is carefully wiping out the interior with a dust cloth. The vendor has his aluminum case on the table near the center of the room. Jeff continues to watch the vendor, his face showing a great concentration of thought. Jeff watching intently. Stella picks up her bag, stares at Jeff's back a moment, then starts for the door. Jeff swivels halfway around in his chair just as Stella reaches the top of the steps. She turns around. Jeff points to a coat-stand near the door. She puts down her bag, reaches for the binoculars, takes them out of the case. She descends the stairs, brings them to him. Stella sniffs, then goes to the door, as she says. As Stella goes out the door, the camera moves in until Jeff's head and the binoculars are filling the screen. He immediately swings to the window and lifts them to his eyes.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: He swiftly turns his wheelchair to face the window in profile while the salesman, having raised the shades, looks out. The salesman's eyes drift toward Jeff's apartment, where Jeff sits with Stella. Jeff almost knocks Stella over with his arm, quickly moving his chair back as she sidesteps with agility. Both in shadow, Jeff focuses on the window. The salesman catches something below his window, tensing visibly. Jeff, restraining Stella, cautiously moves forward to see what caught his attention. The camera reveals an old lady scolding a dog by the fence. The salesman watches intently from the window sill. The camera shows the dog sniffing the salesman's flower bed. Jeff watches the salesman, hearing the old lady caution the dog, which obediently moves away. Amused, Jeff watches Stella put her equipment in her black bag. His gaze shifts back to the salesman, wiping an aluminum case, his amusement fading. Jeff concentrates on the salesman's actions. Stella, with her bag, pauses to watch Jeff, then heads for the door. Jeff signals to a coat-stand, prompting Stella to retrieve binoculars. She brings them to him and exits. The camera zooms in on Jeff and the binoculars as he immediately turns to the window, raising them to his eyes.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Jeff turns his wheelchair to face the window, eyeing the salesman who recently raised the shades. As Jeff nearly knocks Stella with his arm, he moves back, and Stella agilely sidesteps. Both in shadow, they observe the salesman, who suddenly looks downward with tension. Cautiously, Jeff moves forward to see the cause: an old lady, in a faded robe, admonishing a dog near the salesman's flower bed. Amused, Jeff watches as the dog heeds her warning and leaves, but his expression changes when looking back at the salesman's apartment. The salesman wipes a table while Jeff watches intently, deep in thought. Stella, packing her bag, notices Jeff's focus and heads for the door. Jeff gestures towards binoculars on a coat-stand. Stella retrieves them, hands them to him, then exits as Jeff, now with binoculars, turns back to the window.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: With swift determination, he expertly maneuvers his wheelchair, swiftly turning it around to face the window, settling in profile to take in the scene beyond. Meanwhile, the salesman, having just raised the shades in the spacious living room, is now intently gazing out the window. His eyes move with acute focus, edging toward Jeff's apartment. Seated in his chair, facing the window, Jeff is accompanied by Stella standing close beside him. Inadvertently, Jeff nearly sends the startled Stella off balance with an unexpected motion of his arm. He quickly propels his chair backward, as Stella, displaying surprising nimbleness, sidesteps to avoid him. Both remain cloaked in shadow. Jeff persistently fixes his gaze on the window. The salesman, completing his scanning glance over the neighborhood, suddenly finds something directly beneath his window that seizes his attention. He looks sharply downward, his body visibly tensing with anticipation. Jeff, placing a gentle yet firm hand on Stella’s arm to hold her back, cautiously edges his chair forward, eager to see what has captured the salesman's interest. As the camera pans down, we are shown an old lady, who wears a faded house-robe, leaning over a fence, gently admonishing her dog. The salesman, leaning forward, grips the window sill, eyes pinned on the dog. The camera advances, and as it reaches the window's edge, it pans downward to reveal what the salesman observes: the little dog, previously lowered in a basket, sniffing around the salesman's personal flower bed. Jeff’s eyes swiftly rise to gauge the salesman's reaction. We faintly catch her voice muttering something akin to a warning of impending trouble. The old lady's attire—a worn house-robe—suggests a casual familiarity with the scene. The dog, heeding her suggestion, glances at her and then retreats. Jeff finds amusement in the dog’s antics, a brief smile touching his face. Behind him, Stella moves with purpose to the room's center and begins methodically placing her equipment back into her black bag. Jeff's amusement fades as his eyes lift towards the salesman's apartment, where he watches the salesman meticulously wiping the interior with a dust cloth. The aluminum case rests prominently on the table near the room's center. Jeff continues to scrutinize the salesman, his face a canvas of intense thought and concentration. Jeff remains intently watchful. Stella, having gathered her things, pauses to stare at Jeff's back for a moment before heading towards the door. Jeff, alert to her movement, swings halfway around in his chair just as Stella reaches the top of the steps. She turns back, prompted by Jeff's silent gesture toward a coat-stand near the door. She sets down her bag, reaching decisively for the binoculars, extracting them from their case. Descending the stairs, she brings them to him. Stella sniffs the air, then proceeds to the door, making a remark as she exits. As Stella steps out, the camera zooms in until Jeff's head and binoculars dominate the screen. Without hesitation, he swings back to the window, lifting the binoculars to his eyes, keen to observe the unfolding scene with greater clarity.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: With a sense of swift determination and expert control, he skillfully maneuvers his wheelchair, quickly spinning it around to face the window, where he settles in profile to take in the scene unfolding beyond the glass. Meanwhile, the salesman, who has just finished the task of raising the shades in the spacious, airy living room, now stands there intently gazing out the very same window. His eyes are moving with acute focus, gradually edging in the direction of Jeff's apartment. As Jeff is seated comfortably in his chair, facing the window, Stella stands close beside him, a constant presence by his side. Inadvertently, Jeff almost causes the startled Stella to lose her balance with an unexpected and sudden motion of his arm. He quickly moves his chair backward with practiced ease, as Stella, displaying a surprising level of nimbleness, sidesteps swiftly to avoid him. Both remain enveloped in the shadows cast by the room. Jeff persistently keeps his gaze fixed on the window. The salesman, having completed his scanning glance over the neighborhood, suddenly spots something directly beneath his window that seizes his attention completely. He looks sharply downward, his body visibly tensing with anticipation and intrigue. Jeff, placing a gentle yet firm hand on Stella’s arm to signal her to hold back, cautiously edges his chair forward, eager to catch sight of what has captured the salesman's interest so intensely. As the camera pans down, viewers are shown an old lady, who is wearing a faded house-robe that hints at her casual familiarity with the scene, leaning over a fence and gently admonishing her dog. The salesman, leaning forward with heightened interest, grips the window sill as his eyes remain pinned on the dog. The camera advances forward, and as it reaches the window's edge, it pans downward to reveal exactly what the salesman observes: the little dog, which had been previously lowered in a basket, sniffing around the salesman's personal flower bed. Jeff’s eyes swiftly rise to gauge the salesman's reaction to this unexpected intrusion. We faintly catch the old lady's voice muttering something akin to a warning of impending trouble. Her attire—a worn house-robe—suggests a sense of comfort and routine with her surroundings. The dog, heeding her direction, glances back at her and then begins to retreat. Jeff finds mild amusement in the dog’s antics, a brief smile touching his face momentarily. Behind him, Stella moves with a sense of purpose to the room's center, where she begins the methodical process of placing her equipment back into her sturdy black bag. Jeff's amusement fades as his eyes lift toward the salesman's apartment, where he watches the salesman meticulously wiping the interior with a dust cloth. The prominent aluminum case rests conspicuously on the table near the room's center. Jeff continues to scrutinize the salesman, his face a canvas of intense thought and deep concentration. Jeff remains intently watchful. Stella, having gathered her things and securing them neatly, pauses to stare at Jeff's back for a moment before heading confidently towards the door. Jeff, remaining alert to her movement, swings halfway around in his chair just as Stella reaches the top of the steps. She turns back, prompted by Jeff's silent and pointed gesture toward a coat-stand conveniently located near the door. She sets down her bag with care, reaching decisively for the binoculars and extracting them from their case. As she descends the stairs, she brings them directly to him. Stella sniffs the air gently, then proceeds toward the door, making a light-hearted remark as she exits. As Stella steps out, the camera zooms in until Jeff's head and binoculars become the focal point of the screen. Without any hesitation, he swings back toward the window, lifting the binoculars to his eyes with intent, eager to observe the unfolding scene with heightened clarity and precision.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: He swiftly maneuvers his wheelchair in a tight arc to position himself in profile to the window, ensuring a clear view outside. Meanwhile, the salesman, who recently pulled up the living room shades, stands by the window, peering out with keen interest. His gaze shifts gradually, zeroing in on Jeff's apartment. In his chair, Jeff aligns his focus on the window while Stella stands close by. In a sudden motion, Jeff's arm inadvertently jostles Stella, nearly causing her to lose her balance. He then propels his wheelchair backward with urgency, prompting Stella to sidestep with unexpected deftness. Both cast into shadow by the room's lighting, Jeff's focus remains unwaveringly fixed on the window. The salesman, having scanned the surrounding neighborhood, now has his attention snagged by something directly below his window. His focus abruptly shifts downward, and his body visibly tenses. Jeff gently places a restraining hand on Stella, signaling her to pause as he cautiously inches his chair forward to discern what has captured the salesman's interest. As the camera pans downward, it reveals an elderly lady with a hearing aid leaning over a fence, scolding a dog. The salesman leans forward, clasping the window sill tightly, his attention riveted on the scene unfolding below. The camera moves forward with purpose, and upon reaching the window's edge, it pans downward to reveal the spectacle that has drawn the salesman's focus: a small dog, previously lowered in a basket, now sniffing curiously around the salesman's flower bed. Jeff's eyes dart up to observe the salesman's reaction. Faintly, the old lady's voice reaches them, cautioning the dog that trouble awaits if it continues its mischief. Dressed in a faded house-robe, the old lady commands the dog's attention, prompting it to heed her warning and retreat. Amused by the entire incident, Jeff's demeanor reflects a moment of levity. Behind him, Stella moves to the center of the room and begins meticulously stowing her equipment back into her black bag while keeping an eye on Jeff. As Jeff's attention returns to the salesman's apartment, his amusement dissipates, replaced by a focused intensity. Inside, the salesman methodically wipes down the interior of an aluminum case with a dust cloth, the case positioned prominently on the table near the room's center. Jeff observes with deep concentration, his facial expressions betraying a mind at work. Intently watching the salesman, Jeff remains engrossed. Stella secures her bag, pauses briefly to take in Jeff's back before making her way towards the door. Just as she reaches the top of the steps, Jeff swivels halfway around in his chair to catch her attention. Stella stops, turns, and follows Jeff's gesture towards a coat-stand near the door. Understanding his unspoken request, she sets her bag down, retrieves the binoculars from their case and descends the stairs to deliver them to him. With a subtle sniff, Stella heads towards the door, offering a comment as she exits. As Stella leaves, the camera zooms in on Jeff, framing his head and the binoculars prominently within the screen. Without hesitation, Jeff pivots to face the window, lifting the binoculars to his eyes in one fluid motion, ready to resume his scrutiny.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Jeff quickly maneuvers his wheelchair to face the window, while the salesman, having raised the shades, scans the neighborhood. Startling Stella beside him, Jeff reverses his wheelchair as she agilely moves aside. Both are in shadow, and Jeff remains focused on the window. The salesman’s attention is drawn sharply downward, and Jeff cautiously moves forward to see what has captured his interest. The camera reveals an old lady with a hearing aid scolding a dog near the salesman's flower bed. As the salesman watches intently, the camera shows the dog moving off, heeding the lady’s warning. Amused by the scene, Jeff glances up at the salesman, but his amusement fades as he observes the salesman carefully cleaning the interior of an aluminum case. Jeff continues to watch intently, deep in thought. Stella moves to the center of the room, packs her equipment into her bag, and heads for the door. As she reaches the steps, Jeff gestures toward a coat-stand. Stella retrieves binoculars from the bag and hands them to Jeff, then exits. The camera closes in on Jeff as he swings to the window, raising the binoculars to his eyes.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: He quickly turns his wheelchair around to the window until he is in profile, demonstrating the adept maneuverability he's developed after years of navigating mobility challenges. The salesman, having just raised the shades in the living room of this modest urban apartment, is now looking out the window. His eyes move closer toward Jeff's apartment, which is on the second floor of a building known for its lively and observant residents. Jeff, in his chair facing the window, Stella beside him, who is a visiting home healthcare worker with a knack for quick thinking. Jeff nearly knocks the startled Stella off her feet with his arm that reacts to unexpected movements. He propels his chair backward quickly, and Stella moves to the side with surprising agility, a skill honed from years of dance classes in her youth. They are both in shadow as dusk falls over the city. Jeff keeps his eyes trained on the window, a habit formed from his days as a photojournalist seeking the perfect shot. The salesman completes his searching glance at the neighborhood, which is known for its eclectic mix of old and new architecture. Then something directly below his window catches his attention. He looks sharply downward, his body visibly tensing with a detective's instinct for noticing anomalies. Jeff, with a restraining hand to Stella, begins to edge his chair cautiously forward so that he can see what the salesman is looking at. The camera pans down, and we now see that the old lady with the hearing aid, a retired schoolteacher with a soft spot for animals, is leaning over the fence admonishing the dog. The salesman leans forward and grips the window sill as he watches the dog, a small terrier known in the neighborhood for its curious antics. The camera moves forward, and as it reaches the edge of the window, pans down and shows us what the salesman is looking at. The little dog that was lowered in the basket, a common practice in the area for dog owners living in apartments without elevators, is sniffing at the salesman's personal flower bed filled with rare orchids. Jeff's eyes move up quickly to look at the salesman, noting the tension in his stance. We can faintly hear her voice saying something to the effect that he'll get into trouble if he doesn't move. The old lady is wearing a faded house-robe that she received as a gift from her late husband. The dog turns to glance at her and, apparently taking heed, moves away. Jeff is amused at the dog incident, a brief comic relief in an otherwise tense setting. Behind him, Stella moves to the center of the room, saying with a tone suggesting she’s seen it all before. She begins putting her equipment back into her black bag, a well-worn item she’s carried throughout her career. Jeff's eyes lift to the salesman's apartment, and the amusement drains from his face as he observes the meticulous cleaning, indicative of someone who is used to hiding evidence. He is carefully wiping out the interior with a dust cloth. The salesman has his aluminum case, which resembles those often used by traveling salesmen in the mid-20th century, on the table near the center of the room. Jeff continues to watch the salesman, his face showing a great concentration of thought, piecing together a puzzle of suspicion. Jeff watching intently with the focus of a seasoned investigator. Stella picks up her bag, stares at Jeff's back a moment, then starts for the door, sensing the urgency in his demeanor. Jeff swings halfway around in his chair just as Stella reaches the top of the steps. She turns around. Jeff points to a coat-stand near the door, gesturing towards the binoculars hanging there. She puts down her bag, reaches for the binoculars, takes them out of the case, a gift from Jeff’s journalism days. She comes down the stairs, brings them to him, understanding the unspoken request. Stella sniffs, then goes to the door, as she says with a hint of resignation about the unfolding drama. As Stella goes out the door, the camera moves in until Jeff's head and the binoculars are filling the screen, creating a frame of intense scrutiny and anticipation. He immediately swings to the window and lifts them to his eyes, determined to uncover the truth hidden in plain sight.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Jeff, in his wheelchair, turns to the window as a salesman, who just opened the shades, looks out. Jeff nearly knocks over Stella in his haste but pulls back and keeps his eyes on the window. The salesman becomes tense, focusing on something below his window. Jeff cautiously rolls forward to see. The camera reveals an old lady scolding a dog sniffing the salesman's flower bed. Amused, Jeff watches the scene unfold. However, his amusement fades as he sees the salesman cleaning an aluminum case. Intently focused, Jeff's concentration is evident. Stella packs her bag but pauses as Jeff gestures towards a coat-stand. She retrieves binoculars for him before leaving. Jeff immediately uses the binoculars to continue observing the salesman, filling the screen with the intensity of his gaze.

into her black bag Jeff watching intently The dog turns to glance at her and apparently taking heed moves away Jeff's eyes lift to the salesman's apartment and the amusement drains from his face Stella sniffs then goes to the door as she says The salesman has his aluminum case on the table near the center of the room The old lady is wearing a faded houserobe The little dog that was lowered in the basket is sniffing at the salesman's personal flower bed He immediately swings to the window and lifts them to his eyes She turns around His eyes move closer toward Jeff's apartment He quickly turns his wheelchair around to the window until he is in profile As Stella goes out the door the camera moves in until Jeff's head and the binoculars are filling the screen The camera pans down and we now see that the old lady with the hearing aid is leaning over the fence admonishing the dog We can faintly hear her voice saying something to the effect that he will get into trouble Jeff nearly knocks the startled Stella off her feet with his arm He propels his chair backward quickly and Stella moves to the side with surprising agility Jeff keeps his eyes trained on the window The salesman leans forward and grips the window sill as he watches the dog The camera moves forward and as it reaches the edge of the window pans down and shows us what the salesman is looking at Jeff's eyes move up quickly to look at the salesman The salesman having just raised the shades in the living room is now looking out the window They are both in shadow

putting her equipment back into her black bag Jeff's eyes lift to the salesman's apartment and the amusement drains from his face He is carefully wiping out the interior with a dust cloth The salesman has his aluminum case on the table near the center of the room Jeff continues to watch the salesman his face showing a great concentration of thought Jeff watching intently Stella picks up her bag stares at Jeff's back a moment then starts for the door Jeff swings halfway around in his chair just as Stella reaches the top of the steps She turns around Jeff points to a coatstand near the door She puts down her bag reaches for the binoculars takes them out of the case She comes down the stairs brings them to him Stella sniffs then goes to the door as she says As Stella goes out the door the camera moves in until Jeff's head and the binoculars are filling the screen He immediately swings to the window and lifts them to his eyes He quickly turns his wheelchair around to the window until he tensing Jeff with a restraining hand to Stella begins to edge his chair cautiously forward so that he can see what the salesman is looking at The camera pans down and we now see that the old lady with
